author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: LeBreton, Lloyd fastest in 'Pancake' 5K
text:
LeBreton, Lloyd fastest in 'Pancake' 5K By Staff | Oct 15, 2015 
Belfast â€” The 22nd annual "Pancake" 5-Kilometer Road Race set off on Sunday, Oct. 11 from the Belfast Area High School with more than 50 runners and walkers. 
At the race's end, runners and walkers were treated to a pancake breakfast courtesy of the Belfast Rotary club. The race name comes from the flat-as-a-pancake course and the fact pancakes are served to participants after the event. 
The "Pancake" 5K is one of three races put on by the club, the others being the "Kilted Canter" 5K and the "Bug Run" 5K. 
Perry LeBreton of Kenduskeag was the first finisher with a time of 17 minutes and 26 seconds. Sadie Lloyd of Belfast was the first female to cross the 3.1-mile course in 20:53. 
The individual race results were: 1, Perry LeBreton, 41, Kenduskeag, 17:26; 2, Evan Hutchins, 28, Swansville, 19:21; 3, Kurt Steiner, 32, Belfast, 19:28; 4, Jeremy Wilson, 25, Searsport, 19:30; 5, Peter Heslam, 48, Newburyport, Mass., 19:50;
